190752-d-04-06-05-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Switch connecting or operating rod is broken or defective
190752-d-04-06-05-SOO.Accident Cause: Switch connecting or operating rod is broken or defective
190752-d-04-06-05-SOO.Narrative: SWITCH CREW GN21-05 TOOK CONTROL OF TRAIN 882-063 AT PORTAGE DEPOT AND MOVED TO ALLIANT ENERGY, COLUMBIA PLANT, FOR YARDING ON #4 TRACK. HEAD END OF TRAIN WAS ABOUT 50 CARS IN (SOUTHWARD MOVEMENT) ON#4 TRACK WHEN THE TRAIN LOST IT'S AIR AND STOPPED. FOREMAN WALKED BACK AND FOUND 5 CARS DERAILED (CARS 72-76) AT #1 CROSSOVER SWITCH DUE TO BROKEN CONNECTING ROD.  SITE INSPECTION FOUND #1 SWITCH CONNECTING ROD CLIP (THAT ATTACHES CONNECTING ROD TO SWITCH POINT) FOUND BROKEN WITH EVIDENCE OF OLD BREAK.  THE UNSECURED CONNECTING ROD CREATED A SWITCH POINT/STOCK RAIL GAP. THE L2 WHEEL OF COLX 4077 PICKED OR SPLIT THE SWITCH POINT, THE L1 WHEEL FOLLOWED. DERAILED WHEEL SET TRAVELED 5 CARS LENGTHS SOUTH AND FURTHER DERAILED EQUIPMENT, AND CAME TO REST, WHEN IT MADE CONTACT WITH THE SOUTH CROSSOVERSWITCH AND THE NORTH END SWITCH INTO 3 OR 4 TRACK. ALLIANT ENERGY ACCEPTS RESPONSIBILITY.

190779-d-04-06-05-SOO.Narrative: WHILE PROCEEDING WEST ON BN#2 COMING OUT OF THE HOFFMAN CROSSOVER, THE HH43(HAT TRANSFER) WAS STRUCKBY AN EASTBOUND BNSF AUTO TRAIN THAT HAD BEEN DRAGGING EQUIPMENT FOR 1-2 MILES. (FROM MP0.11 ON BNST PAUL SUB TO MP429 ON MERRIAM PARKSUB). THE DERAILED BNSF EQUIPMENT(ETTX904043) STRUCK THE 15TH CAR ON THE HAT WHICH THEN CAUSED 12 CARS ON THE CP TRAIN TO DERAIL AND 7 CARS ON THE BNSF AUTO TRAIN TO DERAIL. OF THE 12 DERAILED CP CARS, 11 ARE EMPTY RESIDUE TANK CARS OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA (UN1005) WHICH ARE ON THEIR SIDE, BUT NOT LEAKING. THERE IS AN ADDITIONAL BOXCAR ALSO ON ITS SIDE. OF THE BNSFCARS, ALL ARE AUTORACKS OF WHICH 2 ARE ON THEIR SIDE. THEIR IS APPROXIMATELY 1200 FEET OF DAMAGE TOBOTH SOO 1 AND BNSF 2. SOO 2 IS ALSO BLOCKED, AND BNSF 1 HAS APPROXIMATELY 400 FEET OF TRACK DAMAGE. NEITHER CREWS WERE INJURIED.BNSF ESTIMATED DAMAGES ARE $220,000.

190954-d-04-19-05-SOO.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 19:30 TRAIN 286-18 (WITH CP 9623) WAS HEADING EAST ON THE APPROACH TO THE CONNECTION TRACKS AT A-20 MAKING THE TRANSITION FROM DYNAMIC BRAKING TO POWER. UPON RETURN TO POWER, TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY AT APPROXIMATELY 19:31. NO ISSUE WITH TRAIN HANDLING PER DOWN LOAD. B/O WAS SET OUT AND TRAIN RECOUPLED.  CREW FAILED TO PROPERLY INSPECT TRAIN AND PROCEEDED WITHOUT REMOVING DRAWBARFROM BETWEEN THE RAILS. THE DRAWBAR DERAILED THE SECOND FROM THE LAST CAR ETTX 860004 AT THE #9 SWITCH ON THE CONNECTION TRACK AT TOWER A-20. THE #7 AND #9 SWITCH WERE DAMAGED. THE LAST CAR (ETTX 902728) WAS DAMAGED BY THE TRAILING TRUCK OF ETTX 860004 WHEN IT LEFT THE CAR AND LODGED UNDER THE LEADING TRUCK OF THE TRAILING CAR. METRA BILLS SUBMITTED FOR TRACK DAMAGES & REPAIRS TOTALING $78,848.88.

2005052-d-04-11-05-DME.Narrative:
CREW WAS SWITCHING THE YARD, KICKING CARS DOWN VARIOUS TRACKS, WHEN THE CONDUCTOR NOTICED THAT THE MAIN LINE DID NOT LOOK RIGHT NEAR THE BOTTOM OF THE BOWL.  UPON INSPECTION, IT WAS FOUND THAT DME 5635 AND HLMX 97934 HAD BYPASSED COUPLERS, DERAILED, AND ROLLED SOME RAIL, CAUSING A TOTAL OF FOUR CARSTO BE DERAILED.  OTHER TWO CARS WERE DME 46067 AND DME 316311.  INVESTIGATING OFFICER CONCLUDED THAT WHILE BYPASSED COUPLERS WAS THE CAUSE OF THIS INCIDENT, IT COULD NOT BE CONCLUSIVELY DETERMINED THAT IT WAS THE FAULT OF THE CREW MEMBERS.  DRAWBARS ON THESE CARS HAVE A TENDENCY TO SLIDE TO THE SIDE EASILY AND ROCK AND ROLL ON THE TRACK COULD HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO THIS INCIDENT.  CREW WAS FOLLOWINGPROPER PROCEDURES AND IT IS UNKNOWN WHAT MORE THEY COULD HAVE DONE TO PREVENT THIS INCIDENT.  CREWWAS NOT DRUG/ALCOHOL TESTED.

THE CREW PULLEDAHEAD UNTIL THEY CLEARED THE SWITCH GOING TOWARDS NORTH 30 AT WHICH POINT LINED THE NORTH 30 THROUGH 38 SWITCH SO THEY WERE LINED INTO NORTH 30 AT THE SOUTH END.  CAR EJE 89010 DRIFTED INTO NORH 30AND CORNERED THE CAR SITTING FIRST OUT SOUTH IN NORTH 29 (DTLX 2814).  DTLX 2814 SUSTAINED DAMAGE TOTHE LEFT CORNER OF THE "A" END.  THE RIGHT CORNER OF THE "B" END OF THE EJE 89101 WAS THE PART OF THE CAR THAT MADE CONTACT WITH DTLX 2814 ON NORTH 29, HOWEVER NO OBVIOUS DAMAGE DONE TO THAT CAR.

65F040522-d-04-14-05-EJE.Primary Accident Cause: Other general switching rules (Provide detailed  description in narrative)
65F040522-d-04-14-05-EJE.Accident Cause: Other general switching rules (Provide detailed  description in narrative)
65F040522-d-04-14-05-EJE.Narrative:
ENGINE 311 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON THE BACKDOOR TRACK WITH 3 FULL SUBS, ENROUTE TO Q-BOP.  AT THE SAMETIME USS ENGINE 9650 WAS TRAVELING UP THE HI-LINE, PUSHING 3 FULL SUBS.  ENGINE 311 CROSSED OVER FROM THE BACKDOOR TRACK ONTO THE Q-BOP LEAD.  EJE REO LINED THE SWITCH TO THE Q-BOP TRACKS AND PROCEEDED TO PUSH SUBS PAST THE ROUTE 5 ROADCROSSING.  THIS PLACED THE LEAD SUB APPROXIMATELY 120` EAST OFTHE CROSSING, WITH THE ENGINE STOPPING IN THE INTERSECTION.  AT THIS POINT THE EJE OPERATOR BLOCKEDTHE FIRST SUB NEXT TO THE ENGINE ON THE SOUTH SIDE.  ENGINE 9650 PROCEEDED DOWN THE HI-LINE WITH 3 EMPTY SUBS.  ENGINE 311 MOVED EAST IN ORDER TO REMOVE THE BLOCKING FROM THE SUB.  THE USS OPERATOR DEPRESSED THE EMERGENCY STOP BUTTON ON HIS REMOTE CONTROL BOX.  THERE WAS INSUFFICIENT CLEARANCE TO STOP THE ENGINE IN ORDER TO PREVENT A COLLISION.  THE IMPACT CAUSED THE MOTOR-END OF SUB 146 TO DERAIL, ALONG WITH US SLUG #2 AND ENGINE 9650.

INVESTIGATION FOUND USS ENGINE 9650 IN VIOLATION OF USSTRANSPORTATION OPERATING RULE FOR STOPPING WITHIN ONE HALF DISTANCE OF SIGHT.

74F040524-d-04-30-05-EJE.Narrative: CREW WAS SHOVING WEST ON THE MAINLINE WHEN THE STUB SILL ON THE "A" END OF HOKX 111348 BROKE OFF THEBOTTOM OF THE CAR CAUSING WHEELS L&R TO DERAIL AT A POINT 40 CAR LENGHTS WEST OF GILMER ROAD.  WHENTHIS HAPPENED THE BRAKE PIPE ON THE SUBJECT CAR WAS ALSO DAMAGED AND AS A RESULT, THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.

THIS ACCIDENT REMAINS UNDER INVESTIGATION AND A CAUSE HAS NOTBEEN DETERMINED AT THIS TIME.  UPDATE:  EVENT RECORDER LOG SHOWS ENGINEER IN THROTTLE POSITION "5"ON A DOWNHILL 0.63 GRADE WITH FIRST SERVICE APPLIED ON THE AUTOMATIC.  ENGINE HAVING 24RL BRAKE WITHOUT PRESSURE MAINTAINING SHOWS A LEAKAGE RESULTING IN FURTHER DEDUCTION IN BRAKE PIPE PRESSURE AND INCREASED TRACTION MOTOR CURRENT AT A SPEED OF 23 MPH WHICH IS CLOSE TO ROCK-OFF THRESHOLD.

2005110-d-04-18-05-ICE.Narrative: SOUTH RAIL AT MP 1.75 BROKE UNDER TRAIN CAUSING WEST TRUCK ON IC 387366 TO DERAIL TO THE SOUTH SIDEOF THE MAIN TRACK.  WHEN THIS CAR PASSED OVER THE SWITCH AT MP 1.5, THE DERAILED WHEELS TRAILED ONTOTHE WEST LEAD OF THE YARD CAUSING THE LEADING TRUCK OF THE NEXT CAR BACK IC 387118 TO DERAIL.  THECARS BECAME SEPARATED AT THIS POINT AND BOTH REMAINED UPRIGHT.  CREW WAS NOT DRUG/ALCOHOL TESTED.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES.
